channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Lamp post, 17th June
item.description:
The lamp post has been leaning over for some time and today another lorry trying to navigate parked cars has bumped it a bit more.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Willow Avenue, Blackfen, London

item.title: The pavement all along Wellington Road, 17th June
item.description:
There are paving slabs and tarmac on the pavement all along the odd side of the road. This has been reported on numerous occasions and is getting worse. Children are having accidents on a daily basis. The pavement is not level. The tarmac has broken into pieces and the paving slabs are cracked and uneven.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wellington Road, Blendon, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside number 28, 17th June
item.description:
A blue panted wooden pallet has been dumped
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 28, Harland Avenue, Longlands, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pret blocking the entire footpath with advertising, 17th June
item.description:
Brett has put an A-frame hoarding sign right in the middle of the pavement blocking all pedestrians. This is a public space and Pret must be breaking the conditions of their rent. They need to be informed about allow allowing pedestrians to use the public space without interference. Please note that as a better citizen then Pret I consciously move the sign on their behalf.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hatfields, Southwark, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown trees over the years, 17th June
item.description:
This house never cuts or maintains the trees. It's very difficult for disabled people and those with prams, especially as we have to pass it every day, with children going to school. It's worse when it is raining as the pedestrian path not accessible.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hazel Walk, Southborough, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned bike, 17th June
item.description:
Abandoned anywhere bike abandoned literally in front of a rail where bikes are supposed to be parked how lazy can a bike renter get these bikes? Need to be banned.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 20, Stamford Street, Southwark, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Road sign is far far too low. Hit my head on it this morning., 17th June
item.description:
Hopefully ok, it is caught on camera too. Please place this sign higher up ASAP so no one is further injured. There is little room to walk by it due to building work hoarding.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Maygrove Road, Kilburn, London

item.title: Abandoned vehicle, 17th June
item.description:
Although this van is taxed and mot'd it has not moved for getting on for a year. It is being used by a local resident for storage of scrap metal . This van and three or four other white vans are taking up valuable parking spaces needed by neighbours living in close proximity .

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Moordown, Shooters Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Followup ref: 7650603 - pigeon spikes damaged, 17th June
item.description:
Hi, the status for 7650603. is 'not the council's responsibility'. Whose responsibility is it then, &who can this be reported to? If the purpose of Fixmystreet is to refer problems to whichever authority is most appropriate, please let them know who
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mentmore Terrace, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
